detailed_goals: Define initial data quality metrics for EHR data related to influenza tracking.
Set weekly targets for improvement (Data Completeness, Data Accuracy, Data Consistency, Data Timeliness, Data Validity).
Generate weekly data quality reports to track progress against the metrics.
Serve as the main point of contact between the hospital and our EHR vendor.
Thoroughly review the EHR system's current capabilities for influenza data collection, identifying any gaps or limitations in meeting our requirements.
Clearly communicate the hospital's specific requirements for influenza data collection, reporting, and analysis to the EHR vendor.
Collaborate with clinical staff to understand current processes.
Identify integration points for new data collection steps related to Patient Registration/Intake for influenza data within the EHR.
Implement a standardized questionnaire during patient registration or intake to collect information on influenza vaccination status, prior influenza infections, and relevant risk factors.
Verify that all required data elements are present for each influenza case, including patient demographics, vaccination status, diagnosis codes, symptoms, lab results, and prescriptions.
Identify and address missing data, implementing strategies to minimize future data gaps.
Cross-validate data elements against source documents (e.g., medical records, lab reports) to ensure accuracy.
Accurately assess patients for influenza symptoms using standardized protocols and tools integrated into the EHR.
Enter patient data into the EHR accurately and completely, including demographic information, medical history, vaccination status, symptoms, and lab results.
Utilize drop-down menus, check boxes, and other data entry tools within the EHR to ensure data standardization and consistency.
Conduct a thorough assessment of the current EHR system to identify gaps in data collection capabilities related to influenza.
Begin planning EHR system updates/modifications for Influenza Data Collection based on assessment.
Develop plan to create new data fields, customize existing workflows, and implement validation rules.
Project kick-off announcement for the EHR project for seasonal influenza data collection.
Develop and distribute initial communication materials (e.g., project overview, FAQs).
Ensure all hospital staff are informed about the EHR project for seasonal influenza data collection, its objectives, progress, and impact on their roles.
Review the existing EHR database schema to identify suitable locations for storing influenza-related data.
Assess existing tables and relationships to determine if any can be leveraged or extended to accommodate the new data elements.
Design new tables specifically for influenza-related data.
Define initial data quality metrics for EHR data related to influenza tracking.
Set weekly targets for improvement (Data Completeness, Data Accuracy, Data Consistency, Data Timeliness, Data Validity).
Generate weekly data quality reports to track progress against the metrics.
Conduct a thorough needs assessment to identify the specific knowledge and skills gaps among staff regarding the new data collection procedures.
Identify all staff members who will be involved in influenza data collection, including nurses, physicians, medical assistants, lab technicians, and data entry personnel.
Define clear and measurable learning objectives for the training program.
Verify that all required data elements are present for each influenza case, including patient demographics, vaccination status, diagnosis codes, symptoms, lab results, and prescriptions.
Identify and address missing data, implementing strategies to minimize future data gaps.
Cross-validate data elements against source documents (e.g., medical records, lab reports) to ensure accuracy.
Accurately assess patients for influenza symptoms using standardized protocols and tools integrated into the EHR.
Enter patient data into the EHR accurately and completely, including demographic information, medical history, vaccination status, symptoms, and lab results.
Utilize drop-down menus, check boxes, and other data entry tools within the EHR to ensure data standardization and consistency.
Conduct a thorough assessment of the current EHR system to identify gaps in data collection capabilities related to influenza.
Begin planning EHR system updates/modifications for Influenza Data Collection based on assessment.
Develop plan to create new data fields, customize existing workflows, and implement validation rules.
Accurately assess patients for influenza symptoms using standardized protocols and tools integrated into the EHR.
Enter patient data into the EHR accurately and completely, including demographic information, medical history, vaccination status, symptoms, and lab results.
Utilize drop-down menus, check boxes, and other data entry tools within the EHR to ensure data standardization and consistency.
Implement or utilize an existing help desk ticketing system to log, track, and manage user inquiries and issues related to the EHR system and influenza data collection.
Offer various support channels for users to report issues, including phone, email, and an online help desk portal.
Ensure timely responses to user inquiries, aiming for a response within 1-2 business hours.
Establish a clear process for reporting data quality issues, utilizing the existing Help Desk ticketing system and encouraging feedback from all users (clinical staff, data entry personnel, etc.).

Log all identified data quality issues in a centralized tracking system, including a detailed description of the issue, the affected data elements, the date of detection, and the reporter's information.
Conduct a thorough root cause analysis for each identified data quality issue to determine the underlying cause(s).
Identify and locate historical medical records (both electronic and paper) containing influenza-related information from previous seasons.

Develop a standardized data abstraction form or template based on the EHR data elements identified in Subtask 1 (patient demographics, vaccination status, diagnosis codes, symptoms, lab results, prescriptions, hospitalizations).
Conduct training sessions for the data abstractors on the protocol, EHR data entry, and quality control procedures.
Thoroughly review the project goals and objectives related to seasonal influenza data collection to ensure alignment with clinical priorities and patient care needs.
Attend project meetings to stay informed about the project's progress, challenges, and key decisions.
Proactively solicit feedback from physicians, nurses, and other clinical staff regarding the EHR system, data collection processes, and training materials.
Identify and locate historical medical records (both electronic and paper) containing influenza-related information from previous seasons.

Develop a standardized data abstraction form or template based on the EHR data elements identified in Subtask 1 (patient demographics, vaccination status, diagnosis codes, symptoms, lab results, prescriptions, hospitalizations).
Conduct training sessions for the data abstractors on the protocol, EHR data entry, and quality control procedures.

Identify specific EHR data elements required for seasonal influenza trend analysis: Patient demographics (age, gender, location), influenza vaccination status, dates of influenza vaccination, influenza diagnosis codes (ICD-10), symptoms reported during visits, lab test results (influenza A/B PCR), antiviral medication prescriptions, and hospitalization records related to influenza.

Define data collection workflow: Extract relevant EHR data elements (as identified in Subtask 1) through automated ETL processes. Data will be pulled from clinical databases and lab systems on a weekly basis. Potential data gaps identified include incomplete vaccination records, inconsistent symptom documentation by clinicians, and missing lab results due to external testing.
Establish a clear process for reporting data quality issues, utilizing the existing Help Desk ticketing system and encouraging feedback from all users (clinical staff, data entry personnel, etc.).
